intro: Tephrosia eriosemoides, commonly known as the silky tephrosia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are often followed by elongated, bean-like pods. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Tephrosia eriosemoides is also noted for its potential use in traditional medicine and as a forage plant for livestock.
